intro: Pedicularis pubiflora, commonly known as the hairy flowered lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it derives some of its nutrients from its host plants. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
